text: You need to include the parent directory of django, usually Lib/site-packages.
I was able to get rid of the import errors executing this cmd

I'm on Mac OS X, but all I had to do was to add:
to my System PYTHONPATH (Found in: Preferences > Pydev > Interpreter - Python)

If it isn't and you're tired of looking, just upgrade to Ubuntu 10.04 and you should be fine.
"Unresolved imports" occur when Eclipse/Pydev does not know what you want to import.
Check your Pydev settings in the Eclipse preferences > Interpreter Python.
Your site-packages folder and things you want to import should be there in the Pythonpath.
If you are facing problem of unused imports then I must say use Eclipse as a IDE as it is providing functionality to remove unused imports by pressing keys ctr+shift+O.
Or In Eclipse there is plugin also available which is doing the same thing automatically when you save your code.You can get that plugin from eclipse plugin site easily and free of cost.

I'm pretty sure this is what you're looking for
